meanings.definition: An act of contesting or disputing
meanings.sent1: The intense contestation between the two teams led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The court case involved a lot of contestation over the ownership of the land.
meanings.sent3: The contestation over who gets to use the swing first turned into a playful game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The contestation for the title of 'Best Chef' in the cooking competition was fierce and full of drama.
meanings.sent5: The contestation for the last piece of cake at the party became the talk of the town.

meanings.sent1: She raised a contestation against the decision made by the committee.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer submitted a contestation to the court regarding the legality of the evidence.
meanings.sent3: His contestation of the new rule caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The contestation of the election results sparked a debate among the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The contestation of the referee's call caused a delay in the game.

meanings.sent1: The contestation between the siblings over the TV remote ended in a compromise.
meanings.sent2: There was a contestation between the neighbors about the property boundary.
meanings.sent3: The contestation between the two friends about the movie genre to watch was finally resolved with a coin toss.
meanings.sent4: The contestation between the two countries led to a diplomatic crisis.
meanings.sent5: The contestation between the students about the project topic was settled by the teacher.
